stem: The intensive care nurse is coordinating care for a client whose ARDS is refractory to standard high-PEEP ventilation. Based on the documentation in the Rescue Therapy Log, match each advanced intervention with its primary physiological mechanism.

tabs.title: Nurses' Notes
tabs.content:
08:00: Client (36y/o female) with ARDS secondary to influenza. P/F ratio is 55. 
09:00: Prone positioning initiated for 18 hours. 
10:30: Inhaled Epoprostenol (Flolan) started. 
12:00: Surgical team arriving for possible V-V ECMO initiation.

tabs.title: Rescue Therapy Log
tabs.content:
TherapyStatusNurse's Observation
Prone PositioningActiveRecruitment of posterior lobes
Inhaled Nitric OxidePendingTargeted pulmonary vasodilation
V-V ECMOOrderedOxygenation occurring outside the body
High-Frequency OscillationTrialedProviding 300+ tiny breaths/min

tabs.title: Vital Signs & Pressures
tabs.content: SpO2 82% (on 100% FiO2). Mean Pulmonary Artery Pressure: 42 (Elevated Pulmonary Hypertension).

columns.text: Selective Pulmonary Vasodilation to reduce PVR
Total Lung Rest while bypass machine provides Gas Exchange
Delivery of small Tidal Volumes at extremely high frequencies
Total elimination of client's own respiratory effort

rationale.correct: Inhaled vasodilators (r1) like Nitric Oxide selectively dilate blood vessels in ventilated areas of the lung (c1). V-V ECMO (r2) is a 'rescue' therapy that takes over oxygenating the blood entirely, allowing the lungs to rest (c2). HFOV (r3) uses tiny tidal volumes to prevent lung injury (c3). Neuromuscular blockade (r4) is used to paralyze the client to stop them from 'fighting' the machine (c4).
clinicalPearls: V-V ECMO is for lung failure; V-A ECMO is for heart AND lung failure.
Inhaled Nitric Oxide should only be used as a 'bridge' to other therapies because it doesn't improve long-term survival.
Cisatracurium (paralytic) requires deep sedation (propofol/fentanyl) because the patient must NOT be awake while paralyzed.

questionTrap.trap: Believing that ECMO fixes the underlying infection/ARDS.
questionTrap.howToOvercome: ECMO is purely SUPPORTIVE. It buys the body time for antibiotics or corticosteroids to work by keeping the patient alive.

mnemonic.title: ECMO = Machine
mnemonic.expansion: E-Extracorporeal (Outside the body). M-Machine (Doing the breathing).
